title.narrative: Power of Dialogue - East Africa - Consortium 2021

description.narrative: UGA-POD-21-C1

title.narrative: 1. The consortium, its network and local CSOs are effective
1. The consortium, its network and local CSOs are effective

description.narrative: 1. The consortium, its network and local CSOs are effective enablers of change
1. The consortium, its network and local CSOs are effective enablers of change

title.narrative: # international L&A resolutions on democratic space adopted

description.narrative: # international L&A resolutions on democratic space adopted

comment.narrative: According to the most recent Afro barometer data (2020) Uganda has not adopted any lobbying and Advocacy resolutions on democratic space. A number of global practices on the individual and organized expression of democratic rights in free space have been trampled upon in Uganda and instead replaced with repressive practices including civil space restrictions, office break-ins and vandalism of CSO premises, silencing the media to curb the flow of information, targeting of private radio stations, use of restrictive legislation to stifle fundamental freedoms and growing intolerance towards peaceful assemblies among other restrictions. These are in direct contravention of international resolutions
During the project lifetime, at least 10 L&A resolutions (Uganda-3, Kenya-3, Ethiopia 2, Sudan 2) are targeted by 2025.

These organizations are however able to identify their capacities sourced from Institutions of higher learning and technical specialists as well as other subject matter specialists.

comment.narrative: staff from NIMD Uganda have formally been trained in Feminist approaches to programming by AMwA

An additional 05 staff from AMwA are targeted for training in the remaining part of the year making a total of 13 PoD partner staff trained in various aspects in accordance to their capacity needs for example Lobby and advocacy skills.. 2 NIMD Ethiopia and 2 Mzalendo staff participated in the gender transformative training

title.narrative: # of studies for evidence-based L&A disseminated

description.narrative: # of studies for evidence-based L&A disseminated

comment.narrative: 4 studies have been conducted by the time of the baseline report though delivered late. A political economy analysis for Kenya, Ethiopia, Uganda and Sudan have been conducted. The studies have been very insightful in understanding the operating contexts of the PoD and also shed light on the programmatic aspects of AMwA and her partners.
2 studies (1 PEA and baseline) that contributed to the regional baseline study were conducted

title.narrative: 2. Aspiring young and women political and civic leaders are
2. Aspiring young and women political and civic leaders are

description.narrative: 2. Aspiring young and women political and civic leaders are influential actors of change
2. Aspiring young and women political and civic leaders are influential actors of change

title.narrative: # of women and youth involved in politics who feel they are able to participate in decision-making processes

description.narrative: # of women and youth involved in politics who feel they are able to participate in decision-making processes

comment.narrative: According to the collected data in Uganda, only 18 out of a sampled 80 representing 23% of women feel they are able and have what it takes to meaningfully participate in decision-making processes. These argued that while there are existing interventions targeting women participation in policy and decision making processes, they are not systemically connected and often key actors engage at the tail end and not work through the whole continuum. In as far as policy implementation is concerned, in addition to women leaders having technical expertise, they also need to intervene along the whole continuum. These also assert that if women leaders were engaged in all processes of decision making, they would be in a position to participate and meaningfully influence these processes to ensure that women issues are integrated from the onset. This is problematic as it then becomes almost impossible to influence decisions at the tail end of the financial process. In Ethiopia, the current trend shows that women and youth in political parties are not influential actors, though we observed encouraging changes in the political career development of EDAC alumni members who were trained by NIMD Ethiopia on other projects. This seed of capacity development needs to be supported by follow up actions by POD

In Ethiopia, Kenya and Sudan the programme targets 20 women and youth in each country. In Uganda, the program targets a numerical value of 40 of the respondents representing 50% of women and youth feel they are able to participate in the decision making processes.

title.narrative: # of women/youth leaders trained

description.narrative: # of women/youth leaders trained

comment.narrative: As at the baseline reporting in Uganda a total of 165 youth and 25 women have been trained. These leaders from the National Youth Council structures from four sub-regions of the Country and 39 districts have been trained in lobbying and advocating as well as influencing political decision making processes. The women leaders were trained in feminist leadership from the women leagues of five political parties namely, Democratic Party (DP), Forum for Democratic Change (FDC), Alliance for National Transformation (ANT), National Unity Platform (NUP), National Resistance Movement (NRM). From the PEA in Ethiopia, NIMD Ethiopia observed promising trend of change among youth and women politicians following their EDAC attendance.
A total of 250 youth leaders are targeted for 2021, meaning that an additional 85 youth leaders will be trained in the remaining part of the year. No other women leaders will be trained this year
57 women /youth leaders were trained

title.narrative: # of CSOs included in the PoD programme (youth led)

description.narrative: # of CSOs included in the PoD programme (youth led)

comment.narrative: Currently, there is no youth-led CSOs included in the program. This is because the program being in its inception phase is still identifying these CSOs through which it will best deliver on the program targets.
By the end of the year, the program team intends to target CSOs that are youth-led. A total of 10 of these organizations are therefore targeted for inclusion in the PoD program for the year 2021.
This indicator is N/A

title.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

description.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

comment.narrative: At the time of the baseline survey, no lobbying and advocacy activities had been undertaken to make the political system more inclusive in 2021. Ruth Asiimwe of Uganda Youth Network noted that because of Government restrictions on engagements resulting from the COVID19 pandemic, engagements with policy makers and power holders aimed at lobbying them for action aimed at making the political system more inclusive have been curtailed. The Chairperson of the Women’s league for DP also observes that the initially intended interventions have also been hard hit given the economic crisis that COVID19 has plunged the global economy in.
Under the PoD, the program team intends to undertake two lobbying and advocacy engagements one targeting the youth with the other for the women.
0 L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women/youth/minority groups) at the national level

title.narrative: # of political/civic actors taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth

description.narrative: # of political/civic actors taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth

comment.narrative: In Uganda,Eleven actors(Entities) had taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth. These included Parliamenty with approdecisionslicies, Political parties such as DP, FDC, UPC, PPP, NUP, JEEMA, and the Green Party of Uganda as well as civic actors including Uganda Women Parliamentary Association (UWOPA), Uganda Parliamentary Forum for Youth Affairs (UPFYA), Forum for Women in Democracy (FOWODE), Uganda Women’s Network (UWONET) and West Minister Foundation for Democracy (WFD)

Baseline value: 13 In Uganda,Eleven actors(Entities) had taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth. These included Parliamenty with approdecisionslicies, Political parties such as DP, FDC, UPC, PPP, NUP, JEEMA, and the Green Party of Uganda as well as civic actors including Uganda Women Parliamentary Association (UWOPA), Uganda Parliamentary Forum for Youth Affairs (UPFYA), Forum for Women in Democracy (FOWODE), Uganda Women’s Network (UWONET) and West Minister Foundation for Democracy (WFD)
End-of-year (2021) target value: 50 The program intends to target a total of fifty (50) entities/ individual actors taking measures to enhance the representation of women and youth. These will include political and civic actors.
0 political/civic actors taken measures enhancing the representation of women and youth

title.narrative: # of created/opened spaces for women/youth (at sub-national level)

description.narrative: # of created/opened spaces for women/youth (at sub-national level)

comment.narrative: As at baseline, there were no created spaces for either women and youth at sub national levels. However, there are some spaces that have been reactivated after many years of redundancy. These however flow from the national levels including regional parliaments that have prior been passive.
The program team targets the opening of two new spaces one targeting women and the other youths. These will be agreed on between the PoD partners and what kind of spaces these will be
2 created/opened spaces for women/youth (at sub-national level)

title.narrative: # of regional L&A campaigns

description.narrative: # of regional L&A campaigns

comment.narrative: One regional lobby and advocacy engagement has been undertaken in the year 2021 under the PoD program. This engagement targeted the youth leaders aimed at influencing policy that affects the young people especially their participation in the National political processes.

Two more engagements one targeting women and the other youths are targeted for the remaining part of the year, making a cumulative total of three (3). These will aim at amplifying the voices of women and the young people including but not limited to their inclusion in the political processes, influencing decision making and opening up spaces for these marginalized segments of society.
0 regional L&A campaigns.
